00017 ParameterList::ParameterList(const ParameterList& right) :
00018   VParameterNode(right._default_key, right._helptext)
00019 {
00020   _node_type = PARAMETER_LIST;

00023 ParameterList& ParameterList::operator=(const ParameterList& right)
00024 {
00025   _deleter.clear();
00026   _parameters.clear();
00027   return *this;
00028 }

00030 VParameterNode* const ParameterList::GetParameter(const std::string& key){
00031   ParMap::iterator it = _parameters.find(key);
00032   if(it != _parameters.end()) 
00033     return it->second;
00034   else 
00035     return 0;
00036 }
00037 
00038 std::istream& ParameterList::ReadFrom(std::istream& in, bool single)
00039 {
00040   if(_parameters.empty())
00041     InitializeParameterList();
00042   char next = ' ';
00043   //peek at the next character
00044   while ( in.get(next) ){
00045     //if it's ')', or '}' exit
00046     if( next == ')' || next == '}' )
00047       return in;
00048     //if it's space, \t, \n, or comma, or opening parneth. ignore it and move on
00049     if( next == ' ' || next == ',' || next == '\t' || next == '\n' 
00050         || next == '(' || next == '{' || next == '|' || next == ';')
00051       continue;
00052     //if it's #, it's a comment, so kill the line and move on
00053     if( next =='#' ){
00054       std::string dummy;
00055       std::getline(in,dummy);
00056       continue;
00057     }
00058     //if it's @, it marks the start of a function statement
00059     if( next == '@' ){
00060       std::string func;
00061       in>>func;
00062       if(func == "include"){
00063         std::string fname;
00064         in>>fname;
00065         Message(DEBUG)<<"including file "<<fname<<std::endl;
00066         ReadFromFile(fname.c_str());
00067         continue;
00068       }
00069       else if (func == "copy"){
00070         std::string par1, par2;;
00071         in>>par1>>par2;
00072         Message(DEBUG)<<"Copying all settings of "<<par1<<" to "<<par2<<"\n";
00073         ParMap::iterator it1 = _parameters.find(par1);
00074         ParMap::iterator it2 = _parameters.find(par2);
00075         if(it1 == _parameters.end() || it2 == _parameters.end()){
00076           Message(EXCEPTION)<<"Unable to find one of the parameters "<<par1
00077                             <<" or "<<par2<<" to copy!\n";
00078           throw std::invalid_argument(par1+","+par2);
00079         }
00080         std::stringstream temp;
00081         (it1->second)->WriteTo(temp);
00082         (it2->second)->ReadFrom(temp);
00083         continue;
00084       }
00085       else{
00086         Message(WARNING)<<"Ignoring unknown command: @"<<func<<std::endl;
00087         continue;
00088       }
00089     }
00090     //anything else should be the start of a key 
00091     //so put it back and read in the key
00092     in.unget();
00093     std::string bigkey;
00094     if( !(in>>bigkey) ){
00095       //somethings messed up.  Throw an exception and die
00096       throw std::invalid_argument("Unabled to read parameter list");
00097       return in;
00098     }
00099     
00100     //bigkey may actually be a list of keys like key1,key2,key3
00101     std::vector<std::string> keylist;
00102     size_t searchstart=0;
00103     size_t pos;
00104     while( (pos = bigkey.find(',',searchstart)) != std::string::npos){
00105       keylist.push_back(bigkey.substr(searchstart,(pos-searchstart)));
00106       searchstart = pos+1;
00107       if(searchstart >= bigkey.size()) break;
00108     }
00109     //should be one last key
00110     keylist.push_back(bigkey.substr(searchstart));
00111     
00112     //read all the keys listed
00113     std::streampos start = in.tellg();
00114     for(size_t ikey = 0; ikey<keylist.size(); ++ikey){
00115       in.seekg(start);
00116       std::string key = keylist[ikey];
00117       //see if the key has '.' in it
00118       bool sendsingle = false;
00119       std::string::size_type pos = key.find('.',0);
00120       if( pos != std::string::npos){
00121         //only allow if we're the last key!
00122         if(ikey != keylist.size()-1){
00123           Message(EXCEPTION)<<"Configuration parameters with '.' are "
00124                             <<"only allowed last in a comma set!\n";
00125           throw std::invalid_argument(key);
00126         }
00127         //tell the next node to return after the first value is read
00128         sendsingle=true;
00129         //put back the rest of the "key" for the child to read
00130         in.seekg( in.tellg() - std::streampos(key.length()-pos - 1));
00131         //now we only care about the part before the '.'
00132         key = key.substr(0,pos);
00133       }
00134       
00135       //look for wildcards at the end ('*')
00136       if( key.at(key.length()-1) == '*'){
00137         key.resize( key.size() - 1 );
00138         int wildcardkeysfound = 0;
00139         for(int i=0; i<100; ++i){ //100 is totally arbitrary
00140           std::stringstream keystream;
00141           keystream<<key<<i;
00142           if(_parameters.find(keystream.str()) == _parameters.end())
00143             break;
00144           keylist.push_back(keystream.str());
00145           ++wildcardkeysfound;
00146         }
00147         //make sure there was at least one
00148         if(wildcardkeysfound==0){
00149           Message(EXCEPTION)<<"No keys matching wildcard '"<<key<<"*'!\n";
00150           throw std::invalid_argument(key+"*");
00151         }
00152         continue;
00153       }
00154       
00155       //now look for the actual parameter and read it
00156       ParMap::iterator mapit;
00157       mapit = _parameters.find(key);
00158       if( mapit == _parameters.end() ){
00159         //the key wasn't listed. throw an exception and abort
00160         Message e(EXCEPTION);
00161         e<<"Key "<<key<<" is not a valid parameter for ParameterList '"
00162          <<GetDefaultKey()<<"'"<<std::endl;
00163         throw std::invalid_argument(e.str());
00164         return in;
00165       }
00166       VParameterNode* child = (mapit->second);
00167       child->ReadFrom(in,sendsingle);
00168     }
00169     if(single) 
00170       return in;
00171   }
00172   return in;
00173 
00174 }
00175 
00176 std::ostream& ParameterList::WriteTo( std::ostream& out, int indent)
00177 {
00178   if(_parameters.empty())
00179     InitializeParameterList();
00180   const int paramsPerLine = 3; 
00181   std::stringstream dummy;
00182   dummy<<'\n';
00183   for(int i=0; i < indent; i++)
00184     dummy<<"  ";
00185   const std::string newline = dummy.str();
00186 
00187   //print an opening parenthesis to mark the beginning
00188   out<<"( ";
00189   ParMap::iterator mapit;
00190   mapit = _parameters.begin();
00191   int printed = 0;
00192   //Loop over all the parameters in the map and pass the stream to them
00193   while( !out.fail() && mapit != _parameters.end() ){
00194     int node_type = mapit->second->GetNodeType();
00195     if(node_type == PARAMETER_LIST){
00196       printed = 0;
00197       out<<newline<<(mapit->first)<<" ";
00198       (mapit->second)->WriteTo(out,indent+1);
00199       mapit++;
00200       if(mapit!=_parameters.end() && 
00201          mapit->second->GetNodeType() != PARAMETER_LIST)
00202         out<<newline;      
00203     }
00204     else{
00205       if( ++printed + indent/2 > paramsPerLine){
00206         printed=0;
00207         out<<newline;
00208       }
00209       if(node_type != FUNCTION)
00210         out<<(mapit->first)<<" ";
00211       out<<*(mapit->second);
00212       ++mapit;
00213       if( mapit != _parameters.end() && 
00214           !(dynamic_cast<ParameterList*>(mapit->second)) )
00215         out<<" , ";
00216     }
00217   }
00218   out<<" )";
00219   if(indent == 0) 
00220     out<<'\n';
00221   return out;
00222 }
00223 
00224 int ParameterList::PrintHelp(const std::string& myname) const
00225 {
00226   // this function returns 1 to exit, 0 to print itself, and -n to go up n
00227   VParameterNode::PrintHelp(myname);
00228   std::cout<<"List of sub-parameters:\n";
00229   int parnumber=0;
00230   ParMap::const_iterator mapit; 
00231   for( mapit = _parameters.begin() ; mapit != _parameters.end(); ++mapit){
00232     std::cout<<" "<<std::left<<std::setw(5)<<std::setfill(' ')<<++parnumber
00233              <<(mapit->first)<<std::endl;
00234   }
00235   std::cout<<"\nEnter n) for more information about parameter n"
00236            <<"\n     -n) to go up n levels"
00237            <<"\n      0) to quit the help browser"<<std::endl;
00238            
00239   int response=0;
00240   std::cin >> response;
00241   if(response == 0)
00242     return 1;
00243   else if(response > (int)_parameters.size() ){
00244     std::cerr<<"The number you entered was too large!\n";
00245     return PrintHelp(myname);
00246   }
00247   else if(response > 0){
00248     mapit = _parameters.begin();
00249     for(int i=0; i < response-1; i++) ++mapit;
00250     response = (mapit->second)->PrintHelp(mapit->first);
00251   }
00252   //now response could be the user response or return from a sub-node
00253   if(response == 0)
00254     return PrintHelp(myname);
00255   if(response < 0)
00256     response++;
00257   
00258   return response;
00259 }
